onBoarding.slide1.text1.old: Workspace consists of windows and panels, their\n configurations, and on-screen location. Any\n changes to a workspace are saved automatically.
onBoarding.slide1.text1.new: Workspace consists of windows and panels, their\nconfigurations, and on-screen location. Any changes\nto a workspace are saved automatically

onBoarding.slide2.text2.old: You can rename the workspace\nby double-clicking its name
onBoarding.slide2.text2.new: You can rename the workspace\nby double-clicking on its name

onBoarding.slide3.text1.old:
You can lock and unlock your workspace by
 clicking the lock sign. If the workspace is locked,
 you won’t be able to close existing windows
 or add new ones.
onBoarding.slide3.text1.new: If the workspace is locked, the user\ncan't close the panels, add new ones\nor move them

onBoarding.slide3.text2.old: You can close a workspace by\n clicking the “X” button.
onBoarding.slide3.text2.new:
You can lock and unlock your workspace by
clicking the lock sign. If the workspace is
locked, you won’t be able to close existing
windows or add new ones

onBoarding.slide4.text1.old: You can open any of the saved\nworkspaces by clicking the arrow down\nsign at the bottom of the screen.
onBoarding.slide4.text1.new: You can open any of the saved\nworkspaces by clicking the arrow\ndown sign at the bottom of the screen

onBoarding.slide4.text2.old: To delete a workspace, click on\nthe “X” button next to its name.
onBoarding.slide4.text2.new: To delete a workspace, click on\nthe “×” button next to its name

onBoarding.slide5.text1.old:
You can switch symbols automatically in all windows
by changing it in only one place. In order to do so,
click the Link icon and choose a matching color in all
the relevant windows.
onBoarding.slide5.text1.new:
You can switch symbols automatically in all windows
by changing it in only one place. In order to do so,
click the Link icon and choose a matching color in all
the relevant windows

onBoarding.slide6.text1.old:
You can place Limit, Stop, Stop-Limit or
OCO orders directly on the chart by using
the Mouse Trading feature. To activate
Mouse Trading, click the blue mouse icon
at the top right corner of the chart.
onBoarding.slide6.text1.new:
You can place Limit, Stop, Stop-Limit or
OCO orders directly on the chart by using
the Mouse Trading feature. To activate
Mouse Trading, click the blue mouse icon
at the top right corner of the chart

onBoarding.slide6.text2.old: You can set both the Quantity and Order validity\nin the widget which pops out after activation of\nthe feature.
onBoarding.slide6.text2.new: You can set both the Quantity and Order validity\nin the widget which pops out after activation of\nthe feature

onBoarding.slide6.text3.old: Use drag&drop to modify orders and\npositions, add Stop Loss or Take Profit,\nor change the quantity.
onBoarding.slide6.text3.new: Use drag&drop to modify orders and\npositions, add Stop Loss or Take Profit,\nor change the quantity

onBoarding.slide7.text1.old:
You are not bound to standard
charts or time frames anymore. Create
custom charts in the “Edit mode” and
save them to your Favorites.
onBoarding.slide7.text1.new:
You don’t have to be bound to candlestick
charts and standard timeframes anymore.
Create custom charts in the “Edit mode”
and save them to your Favorites

onBoarding.slide7.text2.old: You can delete a custom chart by clicking\nthe “X” button next to its name.
onBoarding.slide7.text2.new: You can delete a custom chart by clicking\nthe “X” button next to its name

onBoarding.slide8.text1.old: Before placing the order, you can review additional risk\ninformation by extending the Order Entry panel.
onBoarding.slide8.text1.new: Before placing the order, you can review additional risk\ninformation by extending the Order Entry panel

onBoarding.slide9.text1.old:
Any window in the workspace can be
moved and docked with other windows.
Simply drag any window to where you
want to dock it, until blue buttons with
arrows appear.
onBoarding.slide9.text1.new:
Any window in the workspace can be
moved and docked with other windows.
Simply drag any window to where you
want to dock it, until blue buttons with
arrows appear

onBoarding.slide10.text1.old: You can find additional information about each\ninstrument by clicking on the instrument type icon
onBoarding.slide10.text1.new: You can find additional information\nabout each instrument by clicking on\nthe instrument type icon

onBoarding.slide11.text1.old: Drag&drop any field from the list to\ncustomize the info shown in the widget.
onBoarding.slide11.text1.new: Drag&drop any field from the list to\ncustomize the info shown in the widget

onBoarding.slide12.text1.old: You can enable the linking of\nwindows by account
onBoarding.slide12.text1.new: You can enable the linking of\npanels by account

onBoarding.slide12.text2.old: You can enable orders and\nposition filtering by account
onBoarding.slide12.text2.new: You can enable orders and\npositions filtering by account

onBoarding.slide13.text1.old: For a full User Manual,\nclick on the Help button.
onBoarding.slide13.text1.new: For a full User Manual,\nclick on the Help button

onBoarding.slide13.text2.old: Here you can edit general settings,\nhotkeys, trading defaults and more.
onBoarding.slide13.text2.new: Here you can edit general settings,\nhotkeys, trading defaults and more
